page.title: 02River Severn Floods
page.content: There are floods in Sandhurst nearly every year.In 1947 there was a great flood and this covered a wide area.Cattle at Abloads Court were trapped by floods and the farmer had to move 49 of his cattle quickly.the herd of cattle were encouraged to find their own route but they were frightened,so the bull was let out and with a man in a boat leading it,and the cattle followed.They made their way to the Base Lane where they were looked after until flood went down.Farmers,with their tractors used to meet local people who worked in Gloucester,so that they could get through the floods.An elderly occupant of Base Lane cottage had to be brought out sitting in an arm chair.The water came up above the windows.
